oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Merle Haggard [Unedited]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Merle Haggard (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Recording is unedited and from July of 1987.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Merle Haggard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Merle Haggard addresses his concerns with Russia and praises Oliver North -- (01:00) Haggard compares his family to the one from the Grapes of Wrath while discussing "Mama's Hungry Eyes" -- (01:31) Haggard describes the marriage that inspired "My Favorite Memory" -- (02:02) Ralph Emery inquires about the change of age effecting Haggard when he wrote "Are the Good Times Really Over" -- (03:38) Emery inquires is Haggard believes his title of the Poet of the Common Man -- (05:02) Emery questions whether or not there will be a Merle Haggard movie -- (06:53) Emery praises Haggard for the large number of awards he had been nominated for -- (07:51) Emery and Haggard discuss a show Haggard did with Marty Robbins -- (09:13) Emery and Haggard discuss Haggard's second wife Bonnie Owens -- (10:45) Emery introduces Haggard's band, and Haggard reveals the band had been together since 1965
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Haggard, Merle; Haggard, Merle, 1937-2016;
